entry.title: Floating fees and SPV clients
entry.summary: The conversation revolves around Bitcoin transactions and their implementation. The first message suggests that a payment cannot be made spendable due to an issue with the Bitcoin network fee or the internet connection. The second message discusses the implementation of a feature where if numBroadcastPeers is greater than 0, then the transaction has been successfully transmitted over the internet. However, if nodes begin to differ in what they accept, this could cause issues. The third message mentions the need for a fee system in the payment protocol or the ability for recipients to specify inputs and outputs. Lastly, the conversation touches on the idea of child-pays-for-parent and the necessity for someone to focus on it.
